intro: Erioneuron nealleyi var. grandiflorum, commonly known as the large-flowered erioneuron, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to specific regions of South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pale pink to deep red. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture, while its stems are erect and branching. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
